intro: Dyssodia cancellata, commonly known as the net-veined daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, with a distinctive net-like pattern on its leaves. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a rough, hairy texture. Dyssodia cancellata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
